body.p: The following illustration is an example of one possible way to meet the quantitative disclosure requirements in paragraphs 42K–42O of IFRS 7 at the date of initial application of IFRS 9. However, this illustration does not address all possible ways of applying the disclosure requirements of this IFRS.

entry.b: Reconciliation of statement of financial position balances from IAS 39 to IFRS 9 at 1 January 2018

p.b: Fair value through profit or loss

entry.p: From amortised cost (IAS 39) – fair value option elected at 1 January 2018
To fair value through other comprehensive income – debt instruments (IFRS 9)
To fair value through other comprehensive income – equity instruments (IFRS 9)

p.b: Total change to fair value through profit or loss
Fair value through other comprehensive income

entry.p: From fair value through profit or loss (IAS 39) – required reclassification based on classification criteria
From fair value through profit or loss (fair value option under IAS 39) – fair value option criteria not met at 1 January 2018
From fair value through profit or loss (IAS 39) – fair value option revoked at 1 January 2018 by choice
From fair value through profit or loss (fair value option under IAS 39)–fair value through other comprehensive income elected at 1 January 2018
Available for sale (IAS 39) to fair value through profit or loss (IFRS 9) – required reclassification based on classification criteria
Available for sale (IAS 39) to fair value through profit or loss (IFRS 9) – fair value option elected at 1 January 2018
Available for sale (IAS 39) to amortised cost (IFRS 9)

p.b: Total change to fair value through other comprehensive income

entry.p: From fair value through profit or loss (IAS 39) – required reclassification
From fair value through profit or loss (fair value option under IAS 39) – fair value option criteria not met at 1 January 2018
From fair value through profit or loss (IAS 39) – fair value option revoked at 1 January 2018 by choice
To fair value through other comprehensive income (IFRS 9)
To fair value through profit or loss (IFRS 9) – required reclassification based on classification criteria
To fair value through profit or loss (IFRS 9)–fair value option elected at 1 January 2018

p.b: Total financial asset balances, reclassifications and remeasurements at 1 January 2018

entry.p: Includes the effect of reclassifying hybrid instruments that were bifurcated under IAS 39 with host contract components of (a), which had associated embedded derivatives with a fair value of X at 31 December 2017, and (b), which had associated embedded derivatives with a fair value of Y at 31 December 2017.
Includes (c), (d), (e) and (f), which are amounts reclassified from other comprehensive income to retained earnings at the date of initial application.
Includes (g), (h), (i), (j), (k) and (l), which are amounts reclassified from retained earnings to accumulated other comprehensive income at the date of initial application.
